abstract_summ: England is continuing to remove coronavirus restrictions but efforts to track and stop infections are still struggling, reports Adam VaughanSARS and MERS gave us ample warning of the risk of new coronaviruses, but we failed to set up sufficient defences, reports Debora MacKenzieHubei residents are trying to stay positive as hospitals attempt to treat thousands infected by the new coronavirus, reports Donna LuWith the second-highest number of coronavirus cases globally, Italy is taking dramatic steps to slow the spread, reports Adam VaughanMultiple outbreaks worldwide have led to countries stepping up their responses.The coronavirus outbreak has hit the city hard and doctors are racing to treat the rapidly increasing cases, reports Carrie ArnoldChildren will face many hidden negative effects from the new coronavirus– it's not too late to avert them, says Paul RamchandaniTo thwart SARS-CoV-2, labs hurry to hone assays, swap findings and share resources.By Debora MacKenzie and Press AssociationOur chance to limit international outbreaks may be over as the virus spreads in Italy and the Middle East, reports Debora MacKenzieUnder the Lens discusses how structural studies of the SARS-CoV-2 spike glycoprotein might guide a path towards a vaccine.This month’s
title_summ: A spike with which to beat COVID-19?Crisis in New York CityChildren and covid-19Coronavirus jolts labs to warp speedContact-tracing issuesWe were warned, so why couldn't we prevent it?Inside Wuhan's lockdownItaly in lockdownCovid-19 spreads in USCovid-19 goes global
